Player History
Drafted in 2nd round, 44th overall pick, by Columbus in 1965...
Injured on 4/19/1969 with a Sprained Ankle, out for 6 days...
Had first career hit on 4/4/1971, off Paul Toothaker (DIA)...
Hit first career homerun on 4/18/1971, off Rosendo Paniagua (TOL)...
Drove in 6 runs against Malibu on 8/6/1971...
Drove in 7 runs against Toledo on 8/13/1974...
Drove in 6 runs against New Jersey on 6/24/1976...
Won Player of the Week award on 9/8/1976, hitting .455 with 3 HR, 8 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Longport on 2/17/1977 to a 4-year deal worth $4,400,444 per year...
Drove in 7 runs against Diablo on 5/29/1977...
Signed as a free agent by Halifax on 2/1/1981 to a 3-year deal worth $2,763,900 per year...
Traded from Halifax to Plum Grove on 7/30/1982 (Going to PG: 1B H. Severance. Going to HAL: SS S. Alvarado, RF B. Doucette)...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/21/1983, hitting .407 with 1 HR, 9 RBI...
Signed as a free agent by Plum Grove on 2/17/1984 to a 1-year deal worth $2,452,100 per year...
Had 2000th career hit on 6/27/1984, off James Pressnell (PIT)...
Was selected to the 1984 Allstar game...
Released by Plum Grove on 4/7/1985...
Signed as a free agent by Pontiac on 9/1/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $300,000 per year...
